He has trained more than 300 doctors from India and abroad in the field of interventional cardiology and electrophysiology
Dr. Kler is a scientific advisor to various multinational companies incorporated in the USA
He has authored about 150 articles in national and international journals
An eminent speaker, Dr. Kler regularly delivers lectures at various national and international conferences like HRS and ACC
He is often invited as a Guest Faculty in the USA, France, Australia, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Singapore, and Pakistan
In 2005, he was awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India for his tremendous contribution to medicine

Dr. Kler has also been awarded the prestigious D.Sc (Honoris Causa) by Punjab University, Lifetime Achievement Award by the Indian Medical Association, and Times Healthcare Achievers Awards: Legend of Medicine
He has been honoured with the Delhi Medical Association Centenary Award

description: Dr. Vivek Vij is a pioneering liver transplant surgeon credited with developing living donor surgery and standardizing safety protocols to achieve a 100% donor safety profile since its inception in the country.
He is the first surgeon from the Indian subcontinent to publish a series of laparoscopic Donor Hepatectomy in 'Liver Transplantation'.

He is the founder of Liver Transplantation and Hepatobiliary Sciences in Fortis group of Hospitals, starting a highly successful liver transplant program initially at its Noida center and then at Mohali.

Dr. Vij and his team have a cumulative experience of performing more than 2,500 liver transplants, having performed the majority of them at Fortis Hospital, Noida with a record 95% patient and 100% donor success rate.
Dr. Vij has to his credit the Lowest Biliary Complication rate (<4%) in Living Donor Liver Transplant (LDLT) worldwide.
training: Roche Preceptorship, University of Alabama, Birmingham, USA
International Liver Transplant Society (ILTS), Chicago

d26.name: Dr Parveen Gupta
speciality: Advanced Second Line Management for Multiple Sclerosis
description: Dr. Praveen Gupta has established two departments in his 18 years of career in Neurology in two large corporate hospitals in Paras and Artemis, seeing the largest number of OPD (100 patients per day) and IPD (50 patients per day).
He is credited with starting the first stroke centre in Gurgaon and was the first to use Solitaire for mechanical thrombolysis.
He also started DBS in Gurgaon and DBS for epilepsy in Asia.
Dr. Gupta is a frequently invited speaker at national and international conferences.

His treatments and services include a complete neuroscience centre providing the most advanced interventions in all forms, including all kinds of stroke intervention, stroke rehabilitation, botox, cerebral palsy, advanced second line management for multiple sclerosis, epileptic surgery, and DBS surgery for PD patients.

d27.name: Dr Anil Mandhani
d27.education: MBBS, MS (Surgery), M Ch (Urology), DNB ( Urology)
description: Dr. Mandhani has a unique experience of working in the best state-run hospital in India, SGPGIMS, Lucknow, where he helped train more than 100 residents to acquire M.Ch. degrees.
He then worked in the best corporate hospitals in NCR.
The strength of his clinical care is his ethical and humane approach to dealing with various problems in Urology.
His skill sets are unmatched and are supported by his scientific reasoning due to his vast contribution to the field of urology.
His expertise in robotic surgery (more than 550 cases) is unparalleled.
He is known for managing complex situations arising from deviant outcomes of surgeries performed by others.
Dr. Mandhani has a vast experience in kidney transplant surgery (more than 1,000 kidney transplants) with many modifications, establishing him as a leading expert in the field.

d28.name: Dr Krishan Chugh
description: Dr. Krishan Chugh is one of Asia's finest Paediatricians and one of the first Indian Paediatricians to work actively in Paediatric Pulmonology and Allergy.
He has extensive experience in Paediatric and Neonatal Bronchoscopy and is a pioneer in interventional bronchoscopy in children in India.
Dr. Chugh conducts an annual workshop on Paediatric Bronchoscopy at FMRI.
He started the first Paediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) in the country at Kalawati Saran Children Hospital, Lady Harding Medical College, New Delhi in 1982.
He later set up the first PICU in the private sector in India at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, New Delhi.
Currently, he heads the PICU at FMRI and is regarded as one of the best child specialists in Gurgaon and the Delhi NCR region.
Dr. Chugh has a passion for teaching and training young paediatricians, many of whom now successfully run PICUs in their respective cities and towns.
His views on child health issues such as pollution, dengue, and swine flu are highly sought after by the media.
As a recognition of his academic excellence, he has been invited to be on the Editorial Boards of major Indian Paediatrics journals.

He writes extensively for scientific publications and has been the Director of several workshops and courses in Paediatrics, Paediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS), Paediatric Pulmonology, and Paediatric Critical Care.
He has been invited to deliver lectures and orations at various National and International Conferences.
Presently, he is the Dean of the Indian College of Paediatrics and the Chancellor of the College of Paediatric Critical Care.
He has edited several books and contributed chapters to numerous other books.

d29.name: Dr. Rahul Bhargava
description: Dr. Rahul Bhargava started his journey in Stem Cell Transplant at Medanta in 2010 and has completed over 1,500 transplants to date.
He is credited with establishing 10 low-cost centres across India, including at Sarvodaya Hospital, Batra Hospital, and Action Balaji Hospital.
Dr. Bhargava actively collaborates with various government initiatives to provide low-cost BMT treatment with the vision of an anaemia-free and thalassemia-free India.
His vision of creating the first integrated centre of excellence in Haematology, Paediatric Haematology, and Stem Cell Transplant was realized at Fortis Memorial Research Institute.
In 2016, he became the first Indian doctor to perform and popularize stem cell transplant in multiple sclerosis.
Dr. Bhargava is considered one of the best stem cell transplant experts in Delhi and Gurgaon.
In 2018, he screened over 500 children in schools across Haryana and surrounding areas due to his keen interest in community haematology.
He has completed over 1,000 CME programs and is actively involved in building awareness around various blood disorders, earning recognition as one of the best hematologists in Delhi and Gurgaon.

d30.name: Dr Vikas Dua
description: Dr. Vikas Dua is a renowned Paediatric Hemato-Oncologist and Bone Marrow Transplant specialist.
He and his team have performed over 1,000 transplants, achieving some of the best results in Paediatric Hematology Oncology and BMT.
Dr. Dua is known for his excellent outcomes in Stem Cell Transplant, particularly in Paediatric Unrelated and Haploidentical Transplants.
He has accomplished some of the very rare transplants in India that no one else has performed.
His special interests include Benign Paediatric Hematology, Hemato-Oncology, and both matched sibling and unrelated Paediatric Haploidentical Transplants.
training: Expertise in Paediatric Hematology and Bone Marrow Transplant

d31.name: Dr. Vinod Raina
d31.education: MBBS, MD (AIIMS), MRCP (UK), FRCP (Edinburgh and London), FAMS
speciality: Bone Marrow and Stem Cell Transplant
description: Dr. Vinod Raina is one of India’s foremost Medical Oncologists with over 40 years of experience.
He served as Professor and Head of Medical Oncology at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi.
Dr. Raina has special expertise in various cancers including Breast, Lung, Gastrointestinal, Urological, Gynaecological, Lymphomas, and Myelomas.
He has personally performed approximately 400 bone marrow/stem cell transplants for various cancers.
Dr. Raina brings substantial research experience, having been the Principal Investigator of around 50 projects at AIIMS over 24 years.
He co-founded the INDOX network and mentored nearly 70 residents and DM students, many of whom hold leading positions in India and abroad.

He joined FMRI in 2013 as Director and Head of Medical Oncology and Haematology, was promoted to Executive Director in 2017, and became Chairperson of Oncosciences – Fortis Healthcare in January 2020.

d32.name: Dr Udgeath Dhir
d32.post: SENIOR DIRECTOR CARDIO THORACIC VASCULAR SURGERY
description: Dr. Udgeath Dhir has operated on over 7,500 cases in his eleven-year career.
He is formally trained by Dr. Taweseeak in Rheumatic Mitral Valve Repair at Central Chest Institute, Bangkok and recently trained for TAVI.
Dr. Dhir has been associated with Escorts Heart Institute & Research Centre, New Delhi, and was last a Senior Consultant at Medanta- The Medicity, Gurgaon.

He is a member of several prestigious associations including the Society of Thoracic Surgeons (STS), European Association of Cardio-Thoracic Surgeons (EACTS), and International Society of Minimally Invasive Cardiac Surgery (ISMICS).
Dr. Dhir has published papers in leading journals and authored chapters in cardiac surgery textbooks.
He has been awarded Best Paper Presentation at the International Coronary Congress.

d33.name: Dr. Atul Kumar Mittal
d33.education: M.S. (E.N.T.). Safdarjung Hospital, New Delhi. (1991-94 M.B.B.S.University College of Medical Sciences. Delhi, (1985 - 90)

Endoscopic Adenoidectomy with Intracapsular Tonsillectomy and Coblation
description: Dr. Atul Mittal is an eminent E.N.T. Specialist with over 30 years of practice and surgical proficiency.
He is the Director of ENT at Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurugram, where he effectively manages his practice and staff.
Dr. Mittal performs more than 800 surgeries yearly, spanning the entire continuum of Otorhinolaryngology.
His areas of expertise include Minimal Access Endoscopic Sinus and Skull Base Surgery, Balloon Sinuplasty, Endoscopic Adenoidectomy, and Sleep Surgery.
He also performs Thyroid and Laryngeal Surgeries, Cochlear Implantation, and provides immunotherapy for allergic respiratory diseases.
Dr. Mittal has numerous publications in national and international journals and actively participates in conferences and CMEs.

d34.name: Dr. Subhash Jangid
description: Dr. Subhash Jangid is the Director of Orthopaedics & Joint Reconstruction at Fortis Memorial Research Institute, Gurgaon.
He has over 22 years of experience in Orthopaedics, focusing on knee, hip, and shoulder joint surgeries, including replacements.
Dr. Jangid is a well-known faculty in Arthroplasty/Joint Replacement both in India and abroad, and is also a faculty for AO trauma courses.
He has a special interest in peri-articular trauma and was the first surgeon in India to introduce NAV 3 computer navigation for knee replacement surgery.

Dr. Jangid is one of the most experienced joint replacement surgeons in the world using the computer navigation technique, which provides better patient outcomes and faster recovery compared to conventional methods.

d35.name: Dr. Manoj Padman
d35.education: MS Orth,DNB Orth,MSc Research (UK),FRCS Glasgow,FRCS Trauma & Orthopaedics
description: Dr. Padman qualified from Jawaharlal Institute of Post Graduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER), Pondicherry, and is a Diplomate of the National Board of Examinations in Orthopedic Surgery.

He worked in the UK for 10 years in various Orthopedic departments at the University hospitals of Leeds and Sheffield, where he obtained his Fellowship from the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow (FRCS) and passed the intercollegiate exams in Trauma and Orthopedics (FRCS Tr & Orth) in 2008.
During his training in the UK, Dr. Padman conducted basic research on biological reactions to polyethylene used in arthroplasty, earning a Masters in Research from the University of Leeds in 2004.
He completed his fellowship at Sheffield Children's Hospital as a National Fellow in Pediatric Orthopedics and worked as a Consultant - Pediatric Orthopedics before returning to India in June 2009.

With 20 years of experience, he has been associated with prominent institutions such as Sheffield Children's Hospital, Max Healthcare, and Fortis Memorial Research Institute, where he served as a Senior Consultant in Pediatric Orthopedics and Trauma Surgery.

d37.name: Dr. Naresh Trehan
description: Dr. Naresh Trehan is the Chairman and Managing Director of Medanta - The Medicity.
He is a world-renowned cardiovascular and cardiothoracic surgeon with over five decades of experience in the field.
Dr. Trehan has performed over 48,000 successful open heart surgeries.
He has been honored with the Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan awards by the Government of India for his distinguished service in medicine.
He is the driving force behind Medanta - The Medicity, a pioneering institution in healthcare.
training: Trained and practised at New York University Medical Centre, Manhattan in the USA.

d38.name: Dr. Praveen Chandra
description: Dr. Praveen Chandra is a leading Indian Cardiologist and Chairman of Interventional Cardiology at Medanta - The Medicity, Gurgaon, India.
He is recognized as one of the leaders in Angioplasty in India and is proficient in various new devices and technologies.
Dr. Chandra was awarded the Padma Shri in 2016 by the President of India for his success and achievement in the field of medicine.
He has served as Director of Cardiac Cath Lab & Acute MI Services at Max Healthcare and as Consultant Cardiologist at Escorts Heart Institute and Research Center, New Delhi.
He is a fellow of the Endovascular Intervention Society of India and the Asia-Pacific Society of Interventional Cardiology.
Dr. Chandra has been a distinguished faculty member in various international meetings and was the Organizer and Director of the AMI course in New Delhi for 2005 & 2006.
He has published approximately 100 articles, reviews, and abstracts in various national and international journals.
He performed the first Percutaneous Aortic Valve Implantation and Percutaneous Mitral Valve Repair in India.
He was also the first to use the Angio Jet Thrombectomy Device, start the Percutaneous Myocardial Laser Vascularization Program in Asia, and use FFR & Bioabsorbable Stents in India.

d39.name: Dr Anil Bhan
description: Dr. Bhan is an outstanding cardiovascular surgeon and a graduate from Medical College Srinagar, where he was the Best Outgoing Graduate and Gold Medalist.
He has the largest experience in Aortic surgery in India and has conducted over 15,000 successful cardiac and vascular procedures.
Dr. Bhan has designed and developed more than 50 surgical instruments in the field of cardiac surgery.
He was a key member of the team that performed the first successful Heart Transplantation in India in 1994.
Dr. Bhan played a crucial role in starting cardiac surgical programs at Puttaparthi (1992), Whitefield (2001), and Max Heart and Vascular Institute Saket (2004).

d40.name: Dr Arun Garg
description: Dr. Arun Garg is a Senior Neurologist with a primary focus on Stroke.
He pioneered the role of thrombolysis in Acute Stroke in his region.
His expertise includes Neuro-rehabilitation, Occupational therapy, and Stroke prevention.

Dr. Garg has worked at various prestigious institutions including Max Hospital, Patparganj, Swai Man Singh Jaipur University Medical College and Hospital, and the Institute of Human Behaviour and Allied Sciences, New Delhi.
His passion for stroke has led him to UMASS, MA, USA, where he has established collaborations for stroke prevention, education, treatment, rehabilitation, and the latest research.

d41.name: Dr Vinay Goyal
description: Dr. Vinay Goyal is the Chairman of Neurology at the Institute of Neurosciences, Medanta, Gurugram.
He has over 32 years of work experience in neurology, primarily at AIIMS Department of Neurology, where he rose from Senior Resident to Professor.
Dr. Goyal has completed his MBBS and MD (General Medicine) from RNT Medical College, Udaipur, and DM (Neurology) from AIIMS, New Delhi.
He has won several prestigious awards including the IMA Academy of Medical Specialty Distinguished Service Award and the Vishistha Chikitsa Ratna Award.
He is the President of the Movement Disorders Society of India.
Dr. Goyal has numerous publications, articles, and chapters in national and international journals.

description: Dr. (Prof.) Arvind Kumar is a leading Thoracic Surgeon specializing in the surgical treatment of diseases of the chest, including the lungs, pleura, mediastinum, trachea, esophagus, chest wall, and diaphragm.
He has performed over 15,000 thoracic surgeries, with more than 8,000 using minimally invasive methods such as VATS and robotic techniques.
He leads India's largest and most comprehensive Chest Surgery Program, offering state-of-the-art surgical care for various chest ailments.
Dr. Kumar has the largest experience in the country for surgical management of thymic diseases, including Myasthenia Gravis and Thymoma, with exceptional success in robotic thymectomy.
He has delivered 36 years of service at AIIMS, New Delhi, and continues to provide cutting-edge surgical treatment at Medanta.

d43.education: FRCS (Gen Surg) , FRCS (Glas) , FRCS (Edin) , Primary FRCS , MS (THESIS) , MBBS
description: Dr. AS Soin leads India's largest and one of the world's most successful liver transplant programs at Medanta The Medicity.
He has performed over 2500 liver transplants with a 95% success rate, completing 25-30 successful transplants per month.
With 21 years of experience, Dr. Soin has also conducted over 12,000 complex liver, gall bladder, and bile duct surgeries.
He is credited with pioneering liver transplantation in India and is responsible for training many liver transplant teams across the country.

d44.name: Dr Ashok Kumar Vaid
description: Dr. Ashok K. Vaid is a distinguished Medical Oncologist and Chairman of Medical Oncology, Hematology, and Stem Cell Transplant at Medanta Cancer Institute, Gurugram.
He has over 30 years of clinical expertise, including pioneering one of the largest Stem Cell Transplant programs in north India.
Dr. Vaid has conducted the first 25 bone marrow transplants and has been involved in over 40 international and national clinical research studies.
He is known for organizing numerous seminars, workshops, and conferences and has been a significant contributor to cancer research and treatment advancements.
Awarded the Padma Shri in 2009 for his contributions to medicine.

Performed over 39,000 total knee replacement surgeries and more than 60,000 arthroscopic surgeries for sports injuries.

d47.name: Dr Rajesh Ahlawat
d47.education: MCh (Urology) , MNAMS (General Surgery) , MS (General Surgery) , MBBS
description: Dr. Rajesh Ahlawat is a world-renowned name in the field of Minimally Invasive Urology and Renal Transplants with more than 39 years of experience.
An accomplished endourologist, laparoscopic and robotic surgeon, Dr. Ahlawat is known for pioneering the world's first Robotic Kidney Transplant with regional hypothermia.
He has been a teacher and academician, initiating Urology training programs at his affiliated institutions.
Dr. Ahlawat has received several prestigious fellowships and recognitions for his contributions to the field.
He is credited with establishing four successful Urology and Suprarenal Transplant programs in India, contributing significantly to the advancement of urological and renal transplant procedures.

He completed his Fellowship of the Royal College of Surgeons in the UK in 1986 and trained in Vascular Surgery before returning to India.
He founded one of the first independent Departments of Vascular Surgery in India in 1990 and has played a significant role in advancing vascular surgery in the country.

Dr. Parakh has been involved in various prestigious roles, including National convener for the teaching program by the National Board of Examiners and Vice President of the International Society for Vascular Surgery.

description: Dr. Krishna Iyer is a leading pediatric cardiac surgeon in India, known for his extensive experience and contributions to cardiac care for children.

He initiated the first dedicated pediatric cardiac care program in Northern India at Escorts Heart Institute Research Centre (now Fortis-Escorts Heart Institute), which has become a benchmark for cardiac care in India and Southeast Asia.

Dr. Iyer has performed over 10,000 surgeries on babies, children, and adults with congenital heart diseases, including complex procedures such as arterial switch procedures, double switch operations, TAPVC repairs, and Fontan procedures.
He is noted for his pioneering work on the rapid two-stage arterial switch procedure and performed the first successful rapid two-stage arterial switch and double-switch operation in India.

His current interests include perfecting complex neonatal cardiac surgery, addressing cardiac surgery in malnourished infants and children, salvaging late presenters of congenital heart disease, and developing cost-effective cardiac care solutions for developing countries.

Dr. Iyer trained in pediatric and infant cardiac surgery under Dr. R.B.B. Mee at the Royal Children's Hospital, Melbourne, Australia, and has held positions including Additional Professor at AIIMS before establishing the pediatric cardiac care division at Escorts Heart Institute.
